sn23.23:1.2: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:
sn23.23:1.3: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
sn23.23:2.1: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is Māra.
sn23.23:2.3: Form is Māra. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
sn23.23:2.7: Consciousness is Māra. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
sn23.23:2.8: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is Māra.”
sn23.24:1.1: “You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is of Māra-like nature …”
